column1: ISEG - Lisbon School of Economics and Management

In terms of the overall organisation of the economy, industrial production and operations are at the heart of competitiveness. For although products can be copied, factories or the organisational methods of operations are not so easy to imitate. Perhaps for this reason, the current debate regarding re-industrialisation is centred on industry's important role in the creation of innovation capabilities
